critique: This executive order aims to close Guantanamo Bay detention facilities and review the status of detainees. It emphasizes compliance with the Geneva Conventions and seeks to transfer or prosecute detainees where appropriate. It halts military commission proceedings temporarily. The order reflects a commitment to due process and international law, but also acknowledges national security concerns. It could be seen as liberal in its emphasis on human rights and closing a controversial detention facility, but also conservative in its attention to national security.
